titleInfo.title: Anne Shafer, Head of the League of Women Voters, 2004

recordInfo.recordOrigin: Record has been transformed into MODS 3.5 from a Qualified Dublin Core record by the Digital Library of Tennessee, a service hub of the Digital Public Library of America, using a stylesheet available at https://github.com/digitallibraryoftennessee/DLTN_XSLT. mods.abstract: Here Anne Shafer, Head of the League of Women Voters from 1958 to 1961, describes her political work and Civil Rights activism from the mid to late 1960s. A devout Catholic, she talks about organizing members of the church in the Catholic Human Relations Council and overcoming the conservative push-back within the clergy.
